title: DELIVERing library resources to the virtual learning environment

references.title: E-literacy is more than information literacy. Paper given at Elit
references.raw: Thomas, R (2004) E-literacy is more than information literacy. Paper given at Elit 2004. Abstract available online at: http://www.elitconf.org/elit2004/docs/sess4rma1.html

references.title: Electronic resources in the virtual learning environment: a guide for librarians. Chandos Publishing.
references.raw: Program, Vol. 35 No.3, pp. 227-239 Secker, Jane. (2004) Electronic resources in the virtual learning environment: a guide for librarians. Chandos Publishing. Oxford.

references.title: Linking Digital Libraries with VLEs (DiVLE) Programme Available at : http://www.jisc.ac.uk/index.cfm?name=programme_divle
references.raw: JISC (2003), Linking Digital Libraries with VLEs (DiVLE) Programme Available at : http://www.jisc.ac.uk/index.cfm?name=programme_divle MacColl, J. (2001), “Virtuous learning environments: the library and the VLE.

references.title: Networked Guided Environment for Learning.
references.raw: ANGEL: Authenticated Networked Guided Environment for Learning. 2003. Available online: http://www.angel.ac.uk/ [27th November 2003].

references.title: The Headline Personal Information Environment: evaluation of phase one”, D-Lib Magazine. Available at: http://www.dlib.org/dlib/march01/gambles/03gambles.html
references.raw: 15Gambles, A. (2001), “The Headline Personal Information Environment: evaluation of phase one”, D-Lib Magazine. Available at: http://www.dlib.org/dlib/march01/gambles/03gambles.html Gibbons, S. (2003), “Building upon the MyLibrary concept to better meet the information needs of college students”, D-Lib Magazine, Vol. 9 No.3. Available at: http://www.dlib.org/dlib/march03/gibbons/03gibbons.html Headline Project home page. 2001 Available online: http://www.headline.ac.uk/ Harris, Nicole (2003a). DELIVER: User Needs Analysis. Available at : http://www.jisc.ac.uk/uploaded_documents/deliver-deliv-UNA-final.doc Harris, Nicole (2003b). Resource List Management Systems: Analysis of Talislist, ReadingList Direct, and Bookworm.  DELIVER Project. Available at: http://www.jisc.ac.uk/uploaded_documents/deliver_RLM_analysis.doc Hristovski, D., Humar, I. and Rozic-Hristovski,A. (2003), “Developing a multilingual, personalised medical library portal: use of MyLibrary in Slovenia”, Program, Vol.37 No.3, pp146-157.

abstract: Examines a project to integrate digital libraries and virtual learning environments (VLE). Conducted a user needs analysis and evaluated three reading or resource list management systems including TalisList, Sentient Discover and an open source solution, Bookworm. Reports on the technical specification for the system, but also subsequent work to develop a rights management system and a ‘library area’ within the VLE where electronic resources can be placed. Discusses subsequent developments towards the integration of digital libraries and virtual learning environments, including the IMS specification for Resource List Interoperability (RLI). Concludes that collaboration between learning technologists and librarians is essential
